snippet: The Sierra Club’s president, Michael Brune, has acknowledged in a blog post that beginning five years ago, the club accepted $26 million from people connected with Chesapeake Energy.
abstract: Sierra Club president Michael Brune acknowledges that, beginning in 2005, the club accepted $26 million from people connected with Chesapeake Energy, the country's second-largest natural gas producer; some club members are outraged by the announcement, due to Chesapeake Energy's use of the natural gas extraction method known as hydraulic fracturing, on which the club has taken a nuanced position.
lead_paragraph: The Sierra Club’s president, Michael Brune, has acknowledged in a blog post that beginning five years ago, the club accepted $26 million from people connected with Chesapeake Energy.

headline.main: Donations to Sierra Club Raise Ire
headline.print_headline: Donations To Sierra Club Raise Ire
